title: Refine evasive “No” button: bounded arena, proximity trigger, smooth non-overlapping slide

requirements.summary: Constrain the evasive “No” button’s movement to a bounded region surrounding the Yes/No buttons (with padding) and keep it fully visible within that region.
acceptanceCriteria: When the “No” button moves, its translated position always remains inside a clearly bounded region surrounding the Yes/No buttons (with a small padding), and never roams elsewhere in the layout.
The “No” button never becomes partially clipped by the bounded region (i.e., it stays fully visible).

file_operations.description: Replace the current container-wide movement bounds with a dedicated, clearly bounded “button arena” region around the Yes/No buttons (e.g., a relative wrapper sized to the buttons + padding) and compute random target positions within that arena while clamping so the No button remains fully inside (no clipping). Add/adjust refs as needed (e.g., arena ref) and ensure the No button is positioned relative to that arena rather than the larger card area.

requirements.summary: Trigger evasive movement only when the cursor approaches the “No” button (proximity-based), while preserving touch-based dodge behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: Moving the mouse around the page does not cause the “No” button to move unless the pointer is within a defined proximity threshold of the “No” button.
Approaching the “No” button reliably triggers a dodge movement before the pointer reaches the button.
Touch behavior continues to dodge on touch interaction (or equivalent), without requiring precise hovering.

file_operations.description: Remove/avoid immediate onMouseEnter-triggered dodging for desktop and implement proximity detection (e.g., handle mouse move within the button arena) that computes pointer distance to the No button and triggers a reposition only when within a configurable threshold. Add throttling/cooldown to prevent rapid retriggers while the pointer remains near. Keep (or adjust) the existing touch handler so touch interaction still triggers an evasive move without requiring hover.

requirements.summary: Make the “No” button slide smoothly (no bounce) and ensure it never becomes hidden behind or overlaps the “Yes” button by selecting a non-overlapping safe target position.
acceptanceCriteria: The movement animation uses a smooth slide (no overshoot/bounce effect) when transitioning between positions.
During movement, the “No” button never appears behind the “Yes” button (stacking order and/or overlap avoidance prevents hiding).
If a randomly chosen target position would overlap the “Yes” button area, a different target position is chosen so the “No” button remains clearly visible and readable.

file_operations.description: Replace the current bounce-style Web Animations sequence with a smooth slide transition (e.g., via CSS transition on transform or a single ease-out animation without overshoot). Ensure stacking order keeps the No button above the Yes button during/after movement (z-index adjustment when evasive). Add overlap avoidance when choosing a new target: measure the Yes button bounds within the same arena coordinate space and retry/select another candidate if the No button rectangle would intersect the Yes button area (optionally with a small safety margin).

Adjust the evasive button styling to support smooth sliding (e.g., define a default transition for transform on .evasive-button for non-reduced-motion users, while keeping/maintaining reduced-motion behavior) and avoid any bounce/overshoot timing functions.
